Hemisphere A is on the left and hemisphere B is on the right between two vertical walls.

premise: Hemisphere B is smooth, so there is no friction between hemisphere B and the right wall.
conclusion: The only forces acting on hemisphere B are its weight (2mg) and the normal force from hemisphere A.

premise: The vertical component of the normal force must balance the weight of hemisphere B.

premise: The vertical component must balance the weight of hemisphere A.

conclusion: The horizontal component of the normal force from hemisphere B on hemisphere A is equal to (2mg) * cos(30°).

premise: The maximum static friction force between hemisphere A and the left wall is equal to the dynamic friction force, which is equal to the coefficient of dynamic friction (μ) times the normal force.
conclusion: The maximum static friction force is equal to μ * mg.
